intro: Phryma leptostachya subsp. asiatica, commonly known as the Asian whorled woodruff, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its distinctive whorled arrangement of leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale purple flowers in clusters, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas.
